column4: anyone know where I can download additional gnome panel applets?
anyone know how to recover deleted files in ext3?
hmm, it's a bit rough. were they deleted with rm?
no, mv
right, well can't you just rename the file you mv'd with mv?
anyway, people say good things about this: http://www.stellarinfo.com/linux-data-recovery.htm though it's proprietary.
I mv'd them somewhere and then lost them

oh, so you don't know where they are? you could try a 'sudo updatedb; locate name-of-your-file'. you could also hit CTRL-r in the terminal you mv'd them in, and type 'mv'. that will give you the last mv command you did in that terminal (or just use the up-arrows).
no, I lost them as in the directory I mv'd them to is gone
right, so you rm -fr the directory?
I was doing the tutorial on storing your gpg keys on an encrypted fs on a USB key..
but the filesystem I created is gone for some reason
hmm, well it doesn't look good really. there is very little in the way of ext3 recovery, without prior backup.
unless I can recover the encrypted fs.. but I don't know what the problem is
where _should_ this fs be?
its in a file called disk.img on my USB drive... but when I try to mount it, it says bad fs
ahah.. what is the exact error output?
and gparted says there's no partitions on it
you might want to check it's not already mounted. perhaps type 'mount' and see if it there. if so, then 'sudo umount -l /path/to/usbtick'
them remount it manually.
mount it and run an fsck /dev/mapper/usbkey
by the way, is that really the name for your mountpoint?
